289–90, argues for a Xiongnu bureaucracy in the form of a military organisation

25 emperors were set up by the armies in 47 years!

influence on Old Persian via their intrusions into the Middle East. The seasonal migrations of the Achaemenid kings also appear distinctly Inner Asian and point to their steppe origins
hence the title King of Kings borne by the Achaemenid kings

For the early Sassanian military successes against Rome see Frye
For the rise of the Kushans in Central Asia and Afghanistan see Grenet
125, and also discussion on the extent of the Hephthalite state in Biswas
130, provides much the same information and emphasizes that the Hephthalites are a Hunnic people
402–3, the national history of the Sassanians and the Kayanian legends were reshaped to address these pressing contemporary concerns

551. There were 65 revolts of ethnic minorities during the reign of Yesün Temür and 21 revolts during the reign of Tugh Temür. Modern China itself with its many minorities who feel repressed (Tibetans and Uyghurs in particular) must also take note. 13 Dardess

for the rise of Dayan Khan and Altan Khan in the late 15th century and the mid-16th century respectively
